definitions.definition: In a circle around; all round; on every side of; on the outside of.
examples: The snake was coiled about his ankle.

definitions.definition: Over or upon different parts of; through or over in various directions; here and there in; to and fro in; throughout.
examples: Rubbish was strewn about the place.
The children were running about the room.
He was well known about town.

definitions.definition: Indicates that something will happen very soon; indicates a plan or intention to do something.

subdefinitions.definition: On the point or verge of.
subdefinitions.label_groups: with present participle , obsolete or dialect

definitions.definition: Concerning ; with regard to; on account of; on the subject of; to affect.
examples: He talked a lot about his childhood.
We must do something about this problem.

definitions.definition: Concerned with; engaged in; intent on.
Within or in the immediate neighborhood of; in contiguity or proximity to; near, as to place.
examples: I can’t find my reading glasses, but they must be somewhere about the house.
John’s in the garden, probably somewhere about the woodshed.

definitions.definition: On one’s person; nearby the person.
examples: I had no weapon about me but a stick.
The policy covers all belongings and other personal things that somebody can carry about them.

definitions.definition: In or near, as in mental faculties or ( literally ) in the possession of; under the control of; at one's command; in one's makeup.
examples: He has his wits about him .
There was an air of confidence about the woman.

main_definition: In a circle around; all round; on every side of; on the outside of. [from before 1150]
secondary_definitions: Over or upon different parts of; through or over in various directions; here and there in; to and fro in; throughout. [from ca. 1150–1350]
Indicates that something will happen very soon; indicates a plan or intention to do something.
Concerning ; with regard to; on account of; on the subject of; to affect. [from ca. 1150–1350]
Concerned with; engaged in; intent on. [from ca. 1150–1350]
Within or in the immediate neighborhood of; in contiguity or proximity to; near, as to place. [from ca. 1350–1470]
On one’s person; nearby the person. [from ca. 1350–1470]
( figurative ) In or near, as in mental faculties or ( literally ) in the possession of; under the control of; at one's command; in one's makeup. [from ca. 1350–1470]
